intro: Rosa urbica var. puberula, commonly known as the rough dog玫瑰, is a variant of the common dog rose. It is a deciduous shrub native to Europe, characterized by its thorny stems and fragrant pink flowers. The leaves are typically lobed and have a rough texture, which gives the plant its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, often found in hedgerows and woodland edges. This plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and historical use in herbal medicine.
